page.title: 06STEAM ENGINES AT PONTSTICILL
page.content: The steam engines at Pontsticill come from all over the world.There are some from West Germany,East Germany and also South Africa.One of the West German one's is called Graf Schwerin- Lowitz, built in 1908 this is the one used most often on the railway. Sybil was built in Leeds in 1903 and was used in a slate quarry in North Wales. The next steam engine hopefully to be acquired was built in Philadelehia USA in 1930 for the eastern Province Cement Co.Near Port Elizabeth and is a Baldwin 4_6_2,"Pacific".
